title: Lets Encrypt Certificates affected by CAA Rechecking Incident

profile.name: Endless Hosting
profile.about: Endless Hosting provides free shared-hosting services.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Lets encrypt released a statement regarding 3 million certificates being revoked due to a issue in the CA signing process, Looking at your subdomains it appears that you are affected by this incident. When the revoking occurs the certificates the certificates are no longer valid. This may affect automatic flows that use these sites and assume the certificates are valid and have no cert error checking. 

## Steps To Reproduce:

root@Bugslife:~/Desktop/endlesshosting# curl -XPOST -d 'fqdn=support.theendlessweb.com' https://checkhost.unboundtest.com/checkhost
The certificate currently available on support.theendlessweb.com needs renewal because it is affected by the Let's Encrypt CAA rechecking problem. Its serial number is 03a7c9ab7ac09b9e1f8772c181c584bff432. See your ACME client documentation for instructions on how to renew a certificate.

root@Bugslife:~/Desktop/endlesshosting# curl -XPOST -d 'fqdn=jira.theendlessweb.com' https://checkhost.unboundtest.com/checkhost
The certificate currently available on jira.theendlessweb.com needs renewal because it is affected by the Let's Encrypt CAA rechecking problem. Its serial number is 03a7c9ab7ac09b9e1f8772c181c584bff432. See your ACME client documentation for instructions on how to renew a certificate.

## Supporting Material/References:
https://letsencrypt.org/caaproblem/
https://threatpost.com/lets-encrypt-revoke-millions-tls-certs/153413/

## Impact

This may affect automatic flows that use these sites and assume the certificates are valid and have no cert error checking. 
As the certificates will no longer be valid this could aid in a successful phishing attack
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:

Lets encrypt released a statement regarding 3 million certificates being revoked due to a issue in the CA signing process, Looking at your subdomains it appears that you are affected by this incident. When the revoking occurs the certificates the certificates are no longer valid. This may affect automatic flows that use these sites and assume the certificates are valid and have no cert error checking.

Steps To Reproduce:

root@Bugslife:~/Desktop/endlesshosting# curl -XPOST -d 'fqdn=support.theendlessweb.com' https://checkhost.unboundtest.com/checkhost
The certificate currently available on support.theendlessweb.com needs renewal because it is affected by the Let's Encrypt CAA rechecking problem. Its serial number is 03a7c9ab7ac09b9e1f8772c181c584bff432. See your ACME client documentation for instructions on how to renew a certificate.

root@Bugslife:~/Desktop/endlesshosting# curl -XPOST -d 'fqdn=jira.theendlessweb.com' https://checkhost.unboundtest.com/checkhost
The certificate currently available on jira.theendlessweb.com needs renewal because it is affected by the Let's Encrypt CAA rechecking problem. Its serial number is 03a7c9ab7ac09b9e1f8772c181c584bff432. See your ACME client documentation for instructions on how to renew a certificate.

Supporting Material/References:

https://letsencrypt.org/caaproblem/
https://threatpost.com/lets-encrypt-revoke-millions-tls-certs/153413/

Impact

This may affect automatic flows that use these sites and assume the certificates are valid and have no cert error checking.
As the certificates will no longer be valid this could aid in a successful phishing attack

activities.message: Hey, Can I have a update on this?
activities.markdown_message: Hey, Can I have a update on this?

activities.message: Triage team, Can I have update on this?
activities.markdown_message: Triage team, Can I have update on this?

activities.message: So the certificates have now expired :(

Heya,

So sorry for the _extremely_ delayed response, I'll be triaging this as I checked it initially but didn't get around to responding due to the recent news (COVID-19) and pretty much a lot of things getting in my way of responding to reports!

I'll contact the higher-ups with access to JIRA's node and let them know of the certificate requiring renewal!

Cheers,
George
activities.markdown_message:
Heya,

So sorry for the extremely delayed response, I'll be triaging this as I checked it initially but didn't get around to responding due to the recent news (COVID-19) and pretty much a lot of things getting in my way of responding to reports!

I'll contact the higher-ups with access to JIRA's node and let them know of the certificate requiring renewal!

Cheers,
George

activities.message: Not a problem George, Hope you are well and safe.
activities.markdown_message: Not a problem George, Hope you are well and safe.

activities.message:
@gtsatsis  Hey George,
Good news! I just done a quick test seems like its been renewed

robot@Robot:~$ curl -XPOST -d 'fqdn=support.theendlessweb.com' https://checkhost.unboundtest.com/checkhost
The certificate currently available on support.theendlessweb.com is OK. It is not one of the certificates affected by the Let's Encrypt CAA rechecking problem. Its serial number is 03d6a8097cffcab4c300f74722248507febc

robot@Robot:~$ curl -XPOST -d 'fqdn=jira.theendlessweb.com' https://checkhost.unboundtest.com/checkhost
The certificate currently available on jira.theendlessweb.com is OK. It is not one of the certificates affected by the Let's Encrypt CAA rechecking problem. Its serial number is 03d6a8097cffcab4c300f74722248507febc

activities.message: @gtsatsis  Due to the large amount (3million+) of affected certificates being revoked like these ones from Lets Encrypt, Please can we disclose this report as a example of the impact of a CA encountering issues.
activities.markdown_message: @gtsatsis Due to the large amount (3million+) of affected certificates being revoked like these ones from Lets Encrypt, Please can we disclose this report as a example of the impact of a CA encountering issues.

activities.message: @pr3r00t I'll quickly ask the team and get back to you on that. Personally, I believe this should be disclosed, but it's not up to me, haha!
